fields.headline: Planning confusion
fields.bodyText: In launching your admirable Piece by piece initiative (6 August), you rightly lament the "creeping threat to Britain's natural world", yet your leader equally laments the abolition of the regional spatial strategy – a blunt instrument with the potential to cover the "hard-pressed south-east and south-west" in cement, clay and glass, with no regard to loss of habitat, environment and landscape. You then accuse councils of "gleefully halting unpopular housing schemes" – well, they're unpopular for the reasons you outline in the Piece by piece initiative. You can't have it both ways. Brendan Gallagher Swanage, Dorset • Thousands of wildlife sites are under threat from development, you say. More than 2 million people have been added to the UK population in the last seven years. I have a feeling that there might just be a link between these two facts. Roger Plenty Stroud, Gloucestershire
